alert.note: Alert for Sabine; San Augustine (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 1:36PM CDT until March 28 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Ayish Bayou Near San Augustine affecting San Augustine and Sabine Counties. For the Ayish Bayou...including San Augustine...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ayish Bayou Near San Augustine. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Lowland flooding of the heavily wooded floodplain will continue for the next several days. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CDT Monday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 12.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 145 PM CDT.
